E990057B424D43418D91C9FA19545854.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

FF3B476A457A4915B4CEE249207F9D8C.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

A9EA09D9DDF7481EB39847B44162863A.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

5CA57EA8A5214A7AAC5B4236FD0A6267.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

2508872EA7DB4CCEBEEB46EB410453E4.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

CCCCA5D453EF49EA9FDFD74EFDC4D3E4.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice; journeyperson; indenture; pre-employment training; designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

BF1ED67727BD4B61B5EC080D92B37CD9.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

F04F364E544F4213B27BBAD65F6A6515.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

0938AF45FB5843AEB420F64F44599F6E.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

3D68358812DE4B2E940B14F4F45F56F3.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

66C779060F254EF9AED31DBA3895E1EC.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

6F9CCC715E574F779E6159390452CB7A.description: Identify designated trades (i.e., cook, food and beverage person and guest services representative) in Saskatchewan that are related to tourism.

09B48A0FF6DC47B090D99DD6D2E25CA5.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

F58FAC77218C4AC091DF1B3E5283EDBA.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

6C3CF3DF6A304740811915607EF76E1F.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

E888B7ECADB542E2A735191A21F9FDE5.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

11DF4588F8654A3DBD74437BA8F447EC.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

8AE87EAC68D6454FB67CD8D5469DDA12.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

FA99975A41A84FA090F2DC1FAAB86F0E.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

4E723A18B813468CAAF9FA7E4493BC13.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety and networking observed during the work placement.

D72C7E03F775475494543F620AE2F51C.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

3C4E0A5B883348F0A88BD35B0957CA75.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

E3F27081D60244FFAE6D07A76DC606A3.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

90002DEC47474D1A95A41DC7F2BCD610.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

75A6D95968BE46558A55B8A54CBC8430.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

FA75951510AA44C98DE1486A168FD553.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

9BEBDDAF08DD4CCF9B6C0F05E06D9C15.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear? When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided? What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace? How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative? Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow? Who is the first aid person? Where are safety notices posted? What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

6F936EB311C8461FA44D6247955FE023.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

DFB6935007104480BA44134D8C93EB10.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

AF88DE43BF1D43D7B4DE5CB3CF255B2F.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

21626BD08CF9425C91DA5EC21586E29E.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

36E7E531F03C453583346FBC7E8937E3.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

8E0E5B572F30477DA1D28BE14B494874.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

96B9103699A1444CA3EF0728A56233F0.description: Reflect on personal commitment to working safely at all times.

4BC992CD889E4486A5A5D8ED2399FB3D.description: Develop a list of rules for workplace safety that apply to all regardless of the workplace; sample rules include: Safety in the workplace is a personal and shared responsibility. Dress appropriately and wear personal protective equipment when required. Know emergency evacuation plans and procedures. Keep work areas neat and tidy. Know and follow workplace rules and procedures for working safety. Know personal or individual risks in the workplace and strategies to manage them. Know the procedure for reporting workplace accidents or safety incidents.

A927910EF68249C39C23A120EEFC6D37.description: Analyze a variety of given scenarios pertaining to the tourism sector to identify potential hazards and safety risks and recommend strategies for preventing workplace injuries.

BB0BE1D28E174CCD85874D016CFE9A44.description: Research statistics related to injuries that are common in each of the five industries (i.e., food and beverage, accommodation, recreation and entertainment, transportation, and travel services) in Saskatchewan and Canada.

5BA61817F2A14517AE63AA50A39A147E.description: Develop strategies to mitigate risks identified for each of the five industries.

7445CD04045D468EAFACC2E6039C9A43.description: Discuss risk mitigation and its purpose.

65CC0DD9719B482E8E1A52973CC75409.description: Identify potential safety hazards and risks in each of the five tourism industries. Examples may include: exposure to cleaning products and other chemicals; musculoskeletal injuries from standing for long hours; slips, trips or falls; and burns from dishes, meals or drinks that are hot (food and beverage); ergonomic hazards (e.g., from bending, pushing carts and making beds); slips, trips and falls; respiratory, dermal and carcinogenic hazards from chemicals in cleaning products (accommodation); lifting and handling heavy loads; working at heights; extreme temperatures; exposure to chemicals in liquids such as paints, solvents, cleaners and bleach; and working alone (recreation and entertainment); distracted driving; failure to safety check vehicles; and driver fatigue (transportation); and, working alone in the office; excessive computer use; improper ergonomics (travel services)

BBC418DC034747C386E06118F8B0B1FC.description: Research employer, supervisor and employee responsibilities pertaining to occupational health and safety standards in the workplace as required by Saskatchewan law.

F5A9BB7861C0408BB1694544619AA2A2.description: Discuss the importance to self and others (e.g., customers, colleagues, employer, family and friends) of working safely at all times.

0AF05A19DB8845848A79900D64BB5424.description: Examine strategies for ensuring safety in the tourism workplace.

1F578980C79B434E8FE51BE7C763A279.description: Create and present a travel promotion package for a location in Canada, excluding Saskatchewan, including information that references: all five industries (i.e., food and beverage, accommodation, recreation and entertainment, transportation, and travel services); impacts on social, environmental, cultural and economic sustainability; considerations for personal safety; and, other pertinent information (e.g., availability of basic items and requirements for travel documents).

60AF324EA5394E6EA5E991BFBB0798D3.description: Identify the historical and cultural contributions of other groups to the area.

7F7656D99DF14777BB294D8200BB64C4.description: Examine the historical and cultural contributions of the First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples to the area.

2690793F9F7C4AEA805754153FCAAECD.description: Research answers to questions related to the geography of the destination, such as: location - Where is it (e.g., absolute location, referencing latitude and longitude and relative location, referencing other locations)? Why is it there?, place – What is it like there, considering both physical and human characteristics?, human/environment interaction – What is the relationship between humans and the environment? How has the landscape been shaped by humans?, movement – What examples of movement of people, goods or ideas are present? Has immigration impacted the area? What are the modes of transportation and transportation routes? region – In what region is it located, and how is it similar or dissimilar to other regions?

0C548CDC0D7B45D5A88105105F7AE985.description: Create a travel promotion package for a destination in Canada, excluding Saskatchewan.

59B61614FAC3422FA086AFD93448D32B.description: Reflect on personal contributions to and personal growth resulting from planning and executing the event.

D6AC139228914939B1D0622834972A2E.description: Reflect on the success of the event based upon pre-determined criteria for success.

1BFCA0324254420C917E045841DDEAA5.description: Research options and plan the event details including: operating standards, including safety (e.g., requirements for safe food handling); target market; accommodations (e.g., accessibility and food allergies); food and beverage services; venue; sources of finance; budget; location, date and time; marketing strategies; risk assessment; legal requirements and permissions; criteria for success; and, evaluation and reflection.

4E091FA7C3384C0AA85F6630811F6C5D.description: Create a timeline for the project.

70EC588662A84B8B9E2C037B85B82512.description: Identify factors (e.g., theme, cost, time, number of people, facility and individual/patron requirements) to be considered in the event plan.

9D20B0CD19B94600AE574B45EC49694D.description: Analyze the pros and cons of various opportunities to determine the best option(s) for a class or group project.

D2726DBC86764BA2AFEA51981FC51766.description: Identify existing or new opportunities for events that could be held within the school or community.

9CE19B06EBF0407CBF24BCAB5E30DC5A.description: Identify functions (e.g., graduation banquet, dinner or dessert theatre, feast, community talent night, movie night, school or community barbeque, fowl supper, international supper, bake sale and carnival) that are held within the school and discuss their importance.

20BD2479EA6447479EBFF38981455752.description: Plan, organize, host and evaluate a tourism event in the school or community.

7B80E63CFCC4457E95D40F97C7B12655.description: Discuss the benefits of collaborating with other businesses for marketing purposes (e.g., cross promotion) within the tourism sector.

0089F86777E8478E8B62501CC67B84C8.description: Identify examples (e.g., northern lake versus city and glamping versus camping) of tourism marketing that promotes a unique range of benefits and selling points of their products, services or experiences.

31699CF031D24661A64596C63ACA4E98.description: Examine the benefits and challenges of having competition in the marketplace.

C2C63E9AFF2B4DDFA70CACD2455707E8.description: Assess the value of understanding direct and indirect competitors (e.g., understanding one’s ‘position’ in the market).

E77B6AC07FD54936B494138DC9337FEA.description: Categorize competitors as either direct or indirect for a variety of given scenarios within the tourism sector.

CD959CBCB8454AA88F93BD4C55AFF624.description: Conduct an inquiry into how advertising influences target audiences (e.g., appealing to emotions and peoples’ senses) within the tourism sector.

050A46798BD2480DA694DD630EABAABD.description: Describe the role of advertising within a tourism marketing plan.

3C8D654E1528409EAB2E9AE9EBB0A643.description: Assess the impact of competition and the role of advertising in tourism marketing.

6473F34AE2FC400589A9383E121EAB0D.description: Research factors (e.g., age, gender and sexual diversity, education, income, lifestyle, occupation and size of community) to consider when identifying a target audience.

E4F7DD4D8E3440F28B60180B42FCE60F.description: Propose ways (e.g., observation, market research and polling/surveying) to identify target audiences.

3B6CE00C533140C4B1EE717D603D9687.description: Describe the importance of identifying a target audience.

316D7612DE1B4E09B53FCB0F4DA12DE2.description: Examine common components of a tourism marketing plan such as: situational analysis (i.e., target market, competitor analysis and business environment analysis); marketing objectives (i.e., mission, goals and objectives); marketing activities and strategies (i.e., positioning, distribution channels, advertising and promotion, and packaging); pricing strategy; market research; marketing budget; and, marketing evaluation plan.

3FD3910C25734002928B4907DD4E4699.description: Examine the relationship between target audience and a marketing strategy/plan.

EF8DF350CE46452BA5F36BC4B876A613.description: Discuss ways to salvage customer loyalty when attempts to provide good customer service seemingly fail.

7F83BBFE718B4D45A828D31285A9B853.description: Create and present a scenario that demonstrates a proactive approach to customer service when dealing with internal and/or external customers.

D468C47CD7F648CDA51083947B89C222.description: Describe ways to provide proactive customer for a variety of real-life or fictitious scenarios.

AC8ED323C23D467C8B13E722D8C8976F.description: Discuss the importance of proactive customer service.

995C11B61A1141938BDCBE38FFC2D13B.description: Differentiate between proactive and reactive customer service.

C803235D6E57421CA450DD629E629111.description: Compare expectations (e.g., supports that help co-workers do their jobs effectively) of internal and expectations (e.g., being served with a positive attitude and receiving accurate information) of external customers.

E5E96636B2744A71A2493D1A60CB1408.description: Describe common or typical expectations (e.g., to be served in a timely manner, to be treated with kindness and respect and to receive or experience the desired outcome) of both internal and external customers.

4184F05BBF3A4F3F92671C7F2447ECA5.description: Distinguish between internal (co-workers) and external (guests) customers and provide examples of both within a tourism business.

B8D55EF891474057B131FF19C5F32F30.description: Analyze the importance of proactive customer service.

AAFDEC6323E64058A5EE70263A6659BE.description: Discuss the importance of a risk mitigation plan including communication strategies to ensure the safety and security of both employees and patrons in response to unforeseen events (e.g., natural disaster or security threat).

858A40739CA64DBB8C68D6D8721DC124.description: Research strategies for managing the safety and security of both guests and workers in a variety of travel services related businesses and scenarios.

7962A680ADB74305A0E2C6198E1ED9F0.description: Explore sustainable practices used by the travel services industry.

CF7E418D41384D9BB03CD7A8F71F7E2C.description: Identify factors (e.g., excellence in customer service, accessibility and competitive edge) that influence the success of a travel services business.

FD99CDD3B31343E293A9819992CEF723.description: Assess the importance of good communication and interpersonal skills for workers in the travel services industry.

BDAD3A71D188415E9AF2539C12E2EE7E.description: Examine the impact (e.g., reduced revenue, convenience and cost savings) of booking travel through a travel agent, through the business directly or online for both the business and the consumer.

6F2E13A9BB3443AFA3928A987A30BE17.description: Differentiate between the different service roles (e.g., travel counsellor and travel booking agent) within the travel services industry.

7DE8848A1B914DA8A05D682ABF1465BC.description: Role-play scenarios for providing quality customer service in the travel services industry.

77A211F101E144BE9A36625A153CAEF5.description: Research ways that the travel services industry can accommodate customers with diverse backgrounds (e.g., cultural, social and demographic) and with diverse needs (e.g., accessibility, communication and mobility).

5F3CFCCD0E3E4E9C9ACCBCBC2782DCDD.description: Reflect on what it means to provide quality customer service within the travel services industry.

D78B812F26A747D3A80840C7A8F4FF01.description: Analyze the elements of quality customer service within the travel services industry.

59761AA5DFD84AB6B866DD62D3E6065D.description: Discuss the importance of a risk mitigation plan including communication strategies to ensure the safety and security of both employees and patrons in response to unforeseen events (e.g., natural disaster or security threat).

98776A438F5240A0BA42D60518E30A8F.description: Research strategies for managing the safety and security of both guests and workers in a variety of transportation-related businesses or scenarios.

0C9D5147BE14408BB4E17F502A486944.description: Examine sustainable practices used within the transportation industry.

D0F7425326A2457FAC536628211AF88E.description: Brainstorm ideas (e.g., canoe or horseback) for transporting guests between venues and locations in Saskatchewan that could contribute to unique experiences for tourists.

6D32A96BE88E471295DD8834E3FB135D.description: Identify factors (e.g., excellence in customer service, location and passenger safety) that influence the success of transportation businesses.

76554B7714FC4CD095534FBCD8E3DB99.description: Assess the importance of good communication and interpersonal skills for workers in the transportation industry.

55BB83CA2BF04C75A10DDD8E5FB3DAC0.description: Differentiate among the different service roles (e.g., taxi driver, bus driver, airline service agent, ferry operator, flight attendant, pilot and train engineer) within the transportation industry.

46C21D86C8CA4C0787AD91B1BE9693E3.description: Role-play scenarios for providing quality customer service in the transportation industry.

54631D7DFB574FA8AABEDC79889C74EC.description: Research ways that the transportation industry can accommodate customers with diverse backgrounds (e.g., cultural, social and demographic) and with diverse needs (e.g., accessibility, communication and mobility).

34A9277599D94ECABAB9DA22BDFEC7BC.description: Reflect on what it means to provide quality customer service within the transportation industry.

9BC41AC862CF426A9E139F2E508AE803.description: Analyze the elements of quality customer service within the transportation industry.

3136951FC7ED4A7292D29FEF57B32E1F.description: Discuss the importance of a risk mitigation plan including communication strategies to ensure the safety and security of both employees and patrons in response to unforeseen events (e.g., natural disaster or security threat).

47B1BDA444F94C929F184ABCCA2A6096.description: Research strategies (e.g., responsible service of alcohol, managing crowds at large events and dealing with common emergency situations) for managing the safety and security of guests in a variety of recreation and entertainment businesses or events.

E25FAA1A9516418E95B0FDB7BB7E9CEA.description: Conduct an inquiry into sustainable practices used by the recreation and entertainment industry.

38DF3FEAE58B46098466B4090456F814.description: Describe factors (e.g., excellence in customer service, competitive pricing, location and marketing) that influence the success of recreation and entertainment businesses and ventures.

32461BECFC0E436DBC9E8F2D8181FAB5.description: Examine the importance of good communication and interpersonal skills for workers in the recreation and entertainment industry.

B35FFB8B95B447B3AB7C487F3663D279.description: Differentiate among the different service roles (e.g., box office clerk, fishing or hunting guide, event planner and heritage interpreter) within the recreation and entertainment industry.

463252F32DE44EF087C86FE31924984D.description: Role-play scenarios for providing quality customer service in the recreation and entertainment industry.

04D876F11BA2472AA1B3BABA0FAECD49.description: Research ways that the recreation and entertainment industry can accommodate customers with diverse backgrounds (e.g., cultural, social and demographic) and with diverse needs (e.g., accessibility, communication and mobility).

D0972CDDA7B64DCBB8B02F99464580D8.description: Reflect on what it means to provide quality customer service within the recreation and entertainment industry.

C709867B35644727A98C01990BDE1339.description: Analyze the elements of quality customer service within the recreation and entertainment industry.

21FA849685D4461897B9ADA4122A8ACC.description: Discuss the importance of a risk mitigation plan including communication strategies to ensure the safety and security of both employees and patrons in response to unforeseen events (e.g., natural disaster or security threat).

6B3AD386766448278E71FCB22EFFA10B.description: Research strategies (e.g., confidentiality, security of valuables and dealing with common emergency situations) for managing the safety and security of guests in a variety of accommodation facilities.

14F19F961DEC4A20A4F360D15790816A.description: Identify sustainable practices used by the accommodation industry.

B91D0661B93C4809BA9503141D08EA4C.description: Explain factors (e.g., excellence in customer service, location and marketing of property) that impact the success of accommodation properties.

78458CEC3E724A0D9022A9F21A2354A4.description: Examine the importance of good communication, interpersonal skills and safety for workers in the accommodation industry.

6E1F0A2F6DFF4BA5B0D1B138EA083AE8.description: Differentiate between front of house (e.g., front desk clerk and concierge) and back of house (housekeeper, maintenance staff and reservations staff) positions within an accommodation business and describe their respective roles.

06E9ED3B9C554B7F93D715B0A9C6217A.description: Role-play scenarios for providing quality customer service in the accommodation industry.

2206F9A4AFCD4AF0B9784E34D1F80B59.description: Research ways that the accommodation industry can effectively serve customers with diverse backgrounds (e.g., cultural, social and demographic) and with diverse needs (e.g., accessibility, communication and mobility).

4D6E923462024B9B8F46A8DA5D842513.description: Reflect on what it means to provide quality customer service within the accommodation industry.

BFEA416B28EB459DADC61037BEA5A533.description: Analyze the elements of quality customer service within the accommodation industry.

BCAF94FAD4EA48FE925C745B6F133C3B.description: Propose ideas for incorporating culinary tourism, including Indigenous culinary experiences, as part of unique visitor experiences in Saskatchewan.

41F9F504443D4EF485FD91D0EEC7A2A7.description: Examine examples of culinary tourism in the province.

02370E4866504D5E8135973C99F4DD87.description: Discuss the importance of culinary tourism within the food and beverage industry.

1C30442A69754F319D651EB2976B3B55.description: Analyze Saskatchewan statistics and facts (e.g., the number of people employed in the industry, the demographics of those employed in the industry and annual spending on food and beverages) to determine the impact of the food and beverage industry on the local and provincial economies and labour market.

8D9C2E99A75943ADA7A1913BAC1E4420.description: Investigate the influence of culture on Saskatchewan’s culinary history.

3939514252B94FC6B7655BF56553E026.description: Research the evolution of the food and beverage industry in Saskatchewan and Canada over the past decade or more.

1AB421C4E05A47CA907FFE2D2286FC7F.description: Identify milestones/factors (e.g., field to table, fast food restaurants using better quality oils, food/safety legislation and no smoking bylaws) in Saskatchewan that have impacted the food and beverage industry.

9C6A1109CA304CDF8D2D191D9E061825.description: Examine the evolution and importance of culinary tourism in Saskatchewan.

A1F0EDB76CC2417AB4A6D1144499C7E8.description: Examine the evolution and importance of culinary tourism in Saskatchewan.

3B00C4C74B634F38A0929765085870B5.description: Examine once-in-a-lifetime travel experiences that are found only in Canada through programs such as Destination Canada Signature Experiences.

7568FBC573F149DFB940BA3F4E7BB3BD.description: Describe the work of organizations such as Destination Canada that market Canada as a tourism destination internationally.

5CA17E3B572B4D56A14DFB64E1C2ED97.description: Research strategies that tourism industries can utilize to remain resilient and thrive during times of adversity and/or an economic downturn.

01F064F701D54042A6DD6F82BA2DD257.description: Discuss factors (e.g., pandemic, economic downturn, lack of skilled workers and economic boom) that may contribute to periods of growth and decline in the tourism sector in Canada.

CCE67ADB9F5E47C49EC195D9EFA29D56.description: Interpret statistics and facts related to tourism in Canada, such as: the number of people employed; demographics of those who are employed; the number of visits to and within Canada; popular destinations in Canada; and, annual travel expenditures.

3D182364EBAB4E7993563076BDADDE41.description: Conduct an inquiry into the reasons why Canada may or may not be considered a destination of choice for people in other countries around the world.

17A434BC9D7743F0AF072CB4E3CC0B8C.description: Investigate the attitudes and habits of Saskatchewanians and Canadians pertaining to tourism in Canada.

6658A65BA93642868491FF59E1BAACCA.description: Analyze regional differences in tourism in Canada.

381FED2E49194E3F9813775282DDF359.description: Identify trends in tourism within Canada.

FD213FD6F6F545079290B22E8CB9FDD2.description: Research the evolution of tourism in Canada.

C4ECE598A21946CE83A693945062C149.description: Examine the role and impact of tourism in Canada.
